answer_html: \(\displaystyle \frac{\ln(4/3)}{\ln(6/5)} > 1\) which means that the police arrived MORE than an hour after the murder, that is, the murder took place BEFORE 9:00PM.
answer_latex:
$\displaystyle
\frac{\ln(4/3)}{\ln(6/5)} > 1$  which means that the police arrived MORE
than an hour after the murder, that is, the murder took place BEFORE
9:00PM.
hints_html:
Looking back to Question 2 (a), how long after the murder did the police arrive? When did the police arrive?

Since you do not have access to a calculator during the exam, how can you evaluate ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) without a calculator?

{
Question 2 (a)}, how long after the murder did the police arrive? When
did the police arrive?

Since you do not have access to a calculator during the exam, how can
you evaluate ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) without a calculator?
hints_raw:
Looking back to [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH100/December_2011/Question_2_(a) | Question 2 (a)]], how long after the murder did the police arrive? When did the police arrive?

Since you do not have access to a calculator during the exam, how can you evaluate ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) without a calculator?
question: 2 (b)
sols_html:
We know from Question 2 (a) that the police arrived -ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) hours after the murder (we add a negative sign because we look at this as a positive amount of time now).

So the question is whether -ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) is larger than 1 or not. Let’s see if this is meaningful or not. We know that ln(x) is positive if x is larger than 1. So ln(4/3) is positive and ln(5/6) is negative. Since -ln(5/6) = ln(6/5), we can say that the (positive) amount of time it took for the police to get to the crime scene is ln(4/3)/ln(6/5).

Which of 4/3 or 6/5 is larger? Well, they are the same as 20/15 and 18/15 respectively, so the denominator is smaller than the numerator and likewise if we take a logarithm, hence ln(4/3) > ln(6/5) and so

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \frac{\ln(4/3)}{\ln(6/5)} > 1\end{aligned}\]

which means that the police arrived MORE than an hour after the murder, that is, the murder took place BEFORE 9:00PM.

and so

\begin{align*}

than an hour after the murder, that is, the murder took place BEFORE
9:00PM.
sols_raw:
We know from [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH100/December_2011/Question_2_(a)|Question 2 (a)]] that the police arrived -ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) hours after the murder (we add a negative sign because we look at this as a positive amount of time now).

So the question is whether -ln(4/3)/ln(5/6) is larger than 1 or not. Let's see if this is meaningful or not. We know that ln(''x'') is positive if ''x'' is larger than 1. So ln(4/3) is positive and ln(5/6) is negative. Since -ln(5/6) = ln(6/5), we can say that the (positive) amount of time it took for the police to get to the crime scene is ln(4/3)/ln(6/5).

Which of 4/3 or 6/5 is larger? Well, they are the same as 20/15 and 18/15 respectively, so the denominator is smaller than the numerator and likewise if we take a logarithm, hence ln(4/3) > ln(6/5) and so
:<math>\displaystyle
\frac{\ln(4/3)}{\ln(6/5)} > 1
</math>
which means that the police arrived MORE than an hour after the murder, that is, the murder took place BEFORE 9:00PM.
statement_html:
Full-Solution Problems. In questions 2-8, justify your answers and show all your work. If a box is provided, write your final answer there. Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly stated.

A wealthy man was found murdered in his home. The police arrived on scene at 10:00 P.M. The temperature of the body at 10:00 P.M. was 33\(^{\circ}\)C and one hour later it was 31\(^{\circ}\)C. The temperature of the room in which the body was found was 21\(^{\circ}\)C and normal body temperature is 37\(^{\circ}\)C. Assume that the body cools after death according to Newton’s Law of Cooling.

Did the murder occur before 9:00 P.M.? Please justify your answer.

A wealthy man was found murdered in his home. The police arrived on
scene at 10:00 P.M. The temperature of the body at 10:00 P.M. was
33$^{\circ}$C and one hour later it was 31$^{\circ}$C. The temperature
of the room in which the body was found was 21$^{\circ}$C and normal
body temperature is 37$^{\circ}$C. Assume that the body cools after
death according to Newton's Law of Cooling.

Did the murder occur before 9:00 P.M.? Please justify your answer.

A wealthy man was found murdered in his home. The police arrived on scene at 10:00 P.M. The temperature of the body at 10:00 P.M. was 33°C and one hour later it was 31°C. The temperature of the room in which the body was found was 21°C and normal body temperature is 37°C. Assume that the body cools after death according to Newton's Law of Cooling.

Did the murder occur before 9:00 P.M.? Please justify your answer.
